This list provides a diverse range of articles covering various aspects of endangered language documentation and revitalization, focusing on low-resource languages
**"Language Documentation and Conservation: A Critical Introduction"** by Nicholas Ostler
- A foundational text outlining the importance and challenges of language documentation
- A seminal article on the global state of endangered languages and the need for action
**"Language Revitalization: An Introduction"** by Tove Skutnabb-Kangas
- A comprehensive overview of language revitalization efforts and their complexities
**"The Role of Technology in Language Documentation and Revitalization"** by Mark Turin
- Explores the potential of technology in language preservation efforts
**"Language Documentation and Revitalization: A Framework for Action"** by UNESCO
- A practical guide for language documentation and revitalization projects
**"The Documentation of Endangered Languages: A Handbook"** by Peter K
- A practical guide for documenting endangered languages, covering various aspects of linguistic analysis
**"The Importance of Linguistic Documentation for Endangered Languages"** by Bernard Comrie
- Emphasizes the crucial role of linguistic documentation in understanding and preserving languages
**"The Role of Corpus Linguistics in Language Documentation and Revitalization"** by Mark Davies
- Discusses the use of corpora in documenting and analyzing endangered languages
**"The Use of Digital Technology in Language Documentation"** by David Tuggy
- Explores the application of digital tools for language documentation
**"The Challenges of Documenting Extremely Low-Resource Languages"** by Matthew S
- Addresses the unique challenges of documenting languages with limited available data

- A practical guide for community-based language revitalization efforts
**"The Role of Community in Language Revitalization"** by Jane H

**"Language Revitalization: A Global Perspective"** by T

**"The Use of Technology in Language Revitalization"** by Michael A
- Explores the potential of technology in supporting language revitalization efforts
**"Language Revitalization and the Role of Education"** by Suzanne Evans
- Discusses the importance of education in language revitalization
**Case Studies & Specific Languages:**
**"The Revitalization of the Cherokee Language"** by Durbin Feeling
- A case study of a successful language revitalization project
**"The Documentation and Revitalization of the Hawaiian Language"** by Mary Kawena Pukui
- A case study of language revitalization efforts in Hawaii
**"The Documentation of the Wari' Language"** by David S
- A case study of documenting an extremely low-resource language
**"The Revitalization of the Maori Language"** by Te Taura Whiri i te Reo Maori
- A case study of language revitalization efforts in New Zealand
- A case study of language documentation and revitalization efforts in Japan
